version_a.description: Fixed version with timelock for large withdrawals to prevent instant fund drainage

ground_truth.root_cause: Single-key access control with immediate execution. If the owner's private key is compromised, attacker can instantly drain all funds with no delay or additional authorization required.
ground_truth.attack_vector: Attacker compromises owner's private key (phishing, malware, social engineering). Calls withdraw() to drain all funds immediately. No timelock or multi-sig to prevent or delay the attack.

differential_details.changes_description_a: Added TIMELOCK_DELAY (24 hours), LARGE_WITHDRAWAL_THRESHOLD (10 ether), PendingWithdrawal struct, pendingWithdrawals mapping. Large withdrawals are queued and require executeQueuedWithdrawal() after timelock expires.
differential_details.changes_description_b: Withdrawals execute immediately with no delay, regardless of amount.

exact_changes.version_b: // No timelock constants or pending withdrawal tracking

differential_details.why_this_matters: Timelock gives operators 24 hours to detect key compromise and respond (revoke, transfer ownership, or recover funds) before large withdrawals can execute.
